question: "Pearling, Testimony of an Island Economy" is a UNESCO World Heritage Site of which one of the following nations?
explanation: "Pearling, Testimony of an Island Economy" is also known as Bahrain Parling Trail or Pathway. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site which consisted of three oyster beds, Bu Mahir Fortress and buildings of Muharraq Island. Pearling was the principal industry in Bahrain prior to the discovery of oil in 1932. At present, trading of cultured pearls in Bahrain is prohibited.
